Bash(git -C /Users/mikemannion/workspace/punit commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add SLA verification sizing detection and -Prun filter for test task

When a @ProbabilisticTest is anchored to an SLA \(thresholdOrigin=SLA or
contractRef present\) and the configured sample size is too small to
provide verification-grade evidence, the framework now explicitly warns:
"sample not sized for SLA verification". This prevents misinterpreting
a PASS as SLA compliance evidence when N is insufficient.

Detection uses Wilson score one-sided lower bound \(α=0.001\): if even
zero failures at N samples would produce a confidence bound below the
SLA target, the sample is undersized. The caveat also documents the
pass/fail asymmetry: a PASS is smoke-test-level, but a FAIL remains
a reliable indication of non-conformance.

Also adds -Prun support to the test task \(previously only on exp task\)
and limits sample failure re-throws to maxExampleFailures to prevent
thousands of FAILED lines from drowning the verdict in CLI output.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
